comments:
Though we do most of our development on Tomcat we need to validate on WS also.
The problem noted below would block us from moving from .7 to 1.0

Evaluating WTP M9 using int. build download wtp-sdk-I200511162235 the follow
problems were found defining or running WS 6 server from wtp.

1. Failure to start. This happened frequently but not always. The problem was
that the user enter values for cell and node in the wizard were ignored and the
default vales with the prefix PEPE were used. Causes an i/o error trying to
start the server because these folders are undefined.

2. The Add/Remove project dialog does not filter out projects that are not web
projects. You can select a web project and add it but its dependent projects are
not included in the list (as a subtree).

3. Attempting to publish the app causes an NPE. Here is the stack trace.
java.lang.NullPointerException

Moving to correct component/owner. Please feel free to open up a second bug or
pass back to me if #3 turns out to be a framework problem.

Problem-1 (Bug 112350) was resolved by Gorkem and will be released soon.

I checked Problem-1 and 2. Adding/Removing project and publishing to WAS 6.0
were worked. 
Can any one test the project add/remove and publishing issues under websphere
6.0 runtime with the latest build.

I retested post M9 build: wtp-I200511291312.zip

Problem #2 remains unresolved.

Problem #3 now has a different publish exception thrown. This is what was posted to the Eclipse error log.

Adding to Hot List at Jim's request and setting priority to P2.

I once checked the problem#2. It is not because of WAS configuration, same thing happens while using JBoss, WebLogic etc. I think  it's a generic server issue. It is stated at bug#119584

 One thing I saw while testing, the selected "J2EE Module Dependencies Project" was put into lib directory of the Web application. When I try to unjared  this jar file I got an error that this file was corrupted.
Can anyone verify it?

For problem#3. I created dynamic web project and targeted directly to the WAS without creating EAR project. There is no problem. 

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 119584 ***

Regarding Comment 6 which states:
For problem#3. I created dynamic web project and targeted directly to the WAS
without creating EAR project. There is no problem. 

I believe there is a problem; it just hasn't been reproducable in your environment. I can create a simple web project and pubish it to WAS also. Our web project is considerably more complex. It includes a dozen or more utility jars as well as 21 dependent projects that each contribute additional jars.

I guess the problem is how to identify a use case that can be used to reproduce this problem. Our work around for 1.0 is probably going to be use of a parent EAR project. 

You have marked this as resolved duplicate. For problem #3 which I don't believe is resolved and I am inclined to open a new bug even though I know it may be difficult to provide a use case that reproduces the problem.

This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old is is assumed its dup, invalid, or worksforme resolution is no longer in qustion and the bugzilla needs no further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error in this case.
